tables.table_schema: CREATE TABLE waste_generation_rates (  production_line_id INT,  waste_type VARCHAR(50),  waste_weight DECIMAL(10,2),  date_generated DATE,  PRIMARY KEY (production_line_id, date_generated) );

CREATE TABLE waste_generation (
    waste_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    production_line_id INT NOT NULL,
    waste_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    waste_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (production_line_id) REFERENCES production_lines(production_line_id)
);

CREATE TABLE waste_generation (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  production_line_id INT NOT NULL,
  waste_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  waste_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE waste_measurement (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  bin_id INT NOT NULL,
  type_id INT NOT NULL,
  weight DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
  measurement_date DATE NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (bin_id) REFERENCES waste_bin(id),
  FOREIGN KEY (type_id) REFERENCES waste_type(id)
);

CREATE TABLE production_stats (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  line_id INT NOT NULL,
  total_waste DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
  measurement_date DATE NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (line_id) REFERENCES production_line(id)
);
